Ramazzottius varieornatus is typically found in moss, lichen, and other damp, terrestrial habitats, where it feeds on the fluids of plant cells. Like other tardigrades, it can enter a state of cryptobiosis, a form of suspended animation, in response to environmental stressors, allowing it to survive in harsh conditions for extended periods.

The study of Ramazzottius varieornatus and other tardigrade species has contributed to our understanding of the remarkable adaptations and resilience of these enigmatic microorganisms, which continue to captivate the scientific community and the public alike.
